website_summaries.verdict: This grab bar screws into the wall for ultimate security, and it's great for small spaces.
pros: Supports up to 300 pounds.Flip-up design is ideal for smaller spaces
Durable stainless steel constructionComplies with ADA specifications
Can swing out of the way
cons: To attach all four corners to a wall stud, you will likely need to take out some drywall and install extra wood bracing

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality. Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic purchase. Looks great and works great! I also bought the one with the toilet paper holder. Easy to push up out of the way and it stays put. Easy to pull down. It has added grip and padding where it touches down against the wall bracket. I'm in love with the quality. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Purchased "Moen 30-Inch Flip-Up Bathroom Grab Bar, Stainless (R8960FD) ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased "Moen 30-Inch Flip-Up Bathroom Grab Bar, Stainless (R8960FD) " from Amazon In April of 2016. The hinge cracked an became very unstable.I never placed my full weight on the bar as I used it to steady myself, but even if I had, my 155 lb weight does not exceed the advertised 300 lb weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Chewbacca

customer_reviews.title: Safe and Secure Grab Bar not as ugly as it could be
customer_reviews.text: Saw this at the rehab center and knew that we needed one at home to protect my husband while getting on and off of the toilet. Was happy that it came in the same muted tone as the grab bars I had gotten for our shower but had it been necessary would have purchased the stainless they had at the rehab center. Heavy duty; easily installed; not an eyesore. It even helps him get in and out of the shower safely.
customer_reviews.author: carol birk

customer_reviews.title: Moen 30 inch Flip-Up Grab Bar.  Better for larger people needing safety.
customer_reviews.text: With a disabled 6'4" man who has already fallen in the shower and broke his hip this has turned out to be a god send in front of his shower bench to keep him from sliding forward. Attaches to the wall very sturdy and slides up and down for not in use and in use. Highly recommend this item for person's of bigger stature and weight for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Olemar

customer_reviews.title: Installation is a fete of engineering
customer_reviews.text: Moen wants you to install product in studs and includes six 4" lag bolts for installation. Unless your house is framed with studs on 4-1/2" centers you will not be able to install this device without building some sort of plate between two studs to bolt this thing to. And then you'll need to throw away the lag bolts included and get new full thread 1/4" bolts, length determined by the type of plate you devised. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: B March

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add safety to the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for. It's big and strong enough to provide safety, but the grab bar flips up out of the way when it is not needed. It was easy to install and provided me a way to accommodate my elderly mother in our house without having to install a fixed bar that would dominate the bathroom. The stainless look blends well with the bathroom design such that it does not look out of place.
customer_reviews.author: BH90

customer_reviews.title: Great folding grab bar
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is PERFECT! It provides a great service when needed, and folds up against the wall when not needed. It is sturdy, and well made. However, the screws for the mounting plate are farther apart than the stud in the wall, so a wood base plate had to be mounted on the wall first to cover the expanse between 2 studs. Not the greatest look, but now it is securely attached to the wall. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who might need a bit of stable support in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Belle

customer_reviews.title: sturdy stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: My wife needs bars to get up from a seated position, and these a very sturdy. They come with clips that can be mounted to the wall to hold them in the upright position for cleaning access, but I didn't use them because the bars easily stay in an upright or halfway position without falling down. The bar-mounted toilet paper holder is a little too far back for me, so I just use it for a spare roll. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Ok, I guess I can review this if I have to.

customer_reviews.title: It was a bit of work but something like this should not be entered into unless you have ...
customer_reviews.text: bought two flip up bars for support of my mother and myself in anticipation of a knee operation I am going to need. product is well made and sturdy> much larger than I expected . I had to cut out a portion of the wall tile and sheetrock to access the wall studs. ,and back cut a portion of the studs in order to accommodate the oak plank I used to anchor the base plates. It was a bit of work but something like this should not be entered into unless you have some construction experience, otherwise hire a carpenter
customer_reviews.author: Roosevelt Smyly Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy &sturdy--needs backer boards for installation.
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely heavy (sturdy!!) which means you really can't install unless you are going into backer boarding under drywall. Single stud would only hit 3 of the holes(out of 6) and because of the weight of the grab bar, you would be likely to split the stud. If you have lots of wood already in wall, excellent bars with nice fold up feature. With right installation, these would support very heavy person. But dont try in drywall and single sideways stud!
customer_reviews.author: Retired software tester

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I first encountered it at a rehab, and bought two for my home when I returned from the rehab. One I used outside at my front door as a hand rail to go up and down the steps. After four years it is rust free and still can be raised when moving large objects in or out of the house. Please know that this MUST be properly installed, anchored into a solid wall, preferably into the studs.
customer_reviews.author: Cg Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but gets rust stains quickly
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is secure. I lowered star rating from 5 to 3 because I have rust showing up after only two weeks of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great Rail, Exactly What The MIL Needed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help the mother-in-law when she was staying w/us. She still uses it when she comes to visit. The mother-in-law has has a couple mini strokes & has a tough time getting around, she uses a walker. With this rail, she is able to sit down & get up on her own. We really like that it flips up to be out of the way when she’s not here. The catch on the wall is strong enough & there’s enough resistance on the rails pivot, we do not have to worry about it falling down on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Top quality stainless steel but nylon bushings seem to be wearing out sooner than one would expect...
customer_reviews.text: Top quality stainless steel. I recently had back surgery and this really helps me get up and down - only problem is that the nylon bushing between the movable metal and the hinge is already showing signs of wear and it's only been opened and close a few dozen time - it was very tight upon receipt, then loosened up some but I can see some wear, seems premature but it still works and now I leave it down most of the time anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Tarheelinva

customer_reviews.title: ADA grab bar
customer_reviews.text: Although this is intended for a bathroom , I used it for a boat dock. The fold up/down feature allows us to us it getting on & off the boat with a stable grab bar and to fold it up when not in use. We just bought longer stainless steel screws to add stability when mounting it to the dock pole. The solid stainless design allows me to mount it outside. Good product, Moen !
customer_reviews.author: Peggy in FL

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid support
customer_reviews.text: We used this as a safety bar for the steps to the basement. There is no door, and my father-in-law has to walk past the stairs to get outside. The support is very solid, with three of the 5/16" bolts going into the stud and the other 3 using sturdy hollow wall fasteners with the bolts. The swing up feature makes it very convenient when he does have to go down the steps.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Discrete wihen visitors come, easy to use when needed
customer_reviews.text: My 85 year old father was a bit insulted when I installed this in his new bathroom slightly in the walk in shower and next to the toilet. I showed him that it can be discretely hidden behind the shower curtain when up and is easy to use for both the toilet and shower when down.. He know uses it constantly.... guess daughter knows best ;-) We did put washers between it and the tile on one side as an unevenness in that tile location spread the pivot point just enough to keep the friction from holding it up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda, Wisconsin USA

customer_reviews.title: Great bar
customer_reviews.text: Bar itself is fantastic, Mounting not so good. Would be great if mounted to solid wood. Most of us don't live in a packing crate. For new construction where extra framing could be added this is great. For plaster or drywall Moen has an expensive mounting system but you have to drill holes over 1". not a good option. Toggle bolts don't meet specs..
customer_reviews.author: dead man walking

customer_reviews.title: looks like a quality product, time will tell
customer_reviews.text: just rec the bar this afternoon and got it installed soon after, you do need to make sure you hit at least one stud with 3 of the lags,i cut a small plywood 12 by 19 inches then painted it to match the color of our bathroom and then screwed it to the wall hitting 2 different studs then bolted the bracket with 3 of the big lags into one stud and then used 3 smaller lags to go thur the plywood in the other holes.... works just fine for the wife to get off the toilet
customer_reviews.author: david a streling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: If you have the advantage to install solid support inside the wall before installing, do it. Otherwise the typical spacing of studs in the wall behind your toilet my make installing a challenge. Locate your studs before you order to make sure this will be beneficial. Not going to hold up with hollow wall anchors.
customer_reviews.author: No ya biz

customer_reviews.title: Great Product  !
customer_reviews.text: The Moen 30 -Inch Flip Up Bathroom Grab Bar is excellent. I installed one during a bathroom remodel for a disabled family member. Be aware that it is a heavy duty appliance that needs to be properly mounted on studs. That being said it does the job. It makes bathroom duties safer and easier. It gives me piece of mind knowing that my disabled sister can use it with confidence to get on or off the toilet. I highly recommend this product, it has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Wontz

customer_reviews.title: easy to install (if you have general contracting skills
customer_reviews.text: easy to install (if you have general contracting skills.) Have held up well. We installed on a wall that was already existing and my husband cut the section of drywall out and replaced with wood to make the bars sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: MrsRoro

customer_reviews.title: If you have a shared restroom or shower, folds up to be un obtrusive
customer_reviews.text: Smart Design: Folds up with not in use, comes with lag bolts, well constructed. The plate is big and you need to hit studs on both sides for hanging. I almost removed a star because the manual didn't have a drilling template, but decided against it because the rest was so well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: John Blair

customer_reviews.title: And you thought it was only for bathrooms...
customer_reviews.text: We found a new use for the flip-up grab bar. My husband has limited movement and uses our golf cart to run around our yard/woods. The handle on the side of our golf cart seat has now become an impediment as he tries to enter/exit the cart. We removed the handle, but he didn't feel secure and was concerned he would slide out the side. The flip-up grab bar solved our problem. We secured the bar to the farm bed attached to the rear of our golf cart. Now he can raise the bar to enter/exit the cart; lowering the bar makes him feel secure. Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: willisgma

customer_reviews.title: This bar has to be installed on wood/studs!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't installed product yet but the advertisement was misleading. It read that you could use secure mounts on the flip up bar but you can't. It has to be installed on wood/studs according to instructions and I also called the Moen Company and she verified it. The secure mounts I ordered are only used on the grab bars with the round ends. I think we might find a way to install these bars but the studs don't align where we want to put them. The product was received in good condition and in a quick manner.
customer_reviews.author: barbara bezdon

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These were installed within minutes and now I can do gymnastics getting on and off the toilet. But for real, these are super sturdy and amazingly well made. The clip that holds them in the upright position is very flimsy but that isn’t really what I bought them for. They hold up to my weight (230 lbs) very well with little flex.
customer_reviews.author: Harlen

customer_reviews.title: It takes time, muscle, and patience.
customer_reviews.text: You need a drill with a hex head, an adjustable wrench, a level, and muscle. I measured how close it needs to be for Mom to comfortably reach, then marked this measurement on the wall. I pre-drilled the holes into studs. The lag bolts are very long so you need a longer bit . Once the holes are drilled, attach one lag bolt and another so holes are lined up and then use a level.level. If you have a powerful drill, use a hex head bit to drive these in. I had to use a wrench to sink them completely. The steel will scratch easily. Very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had a family member install this for me in my home. He had to put some extra bracing on the wall to be able for all 6 bolts to have something to anchor to, but installation was pretty straight forward otherwise. It is very sturdy and well mounted now. I couldn’t function without it.
customer_reviews.author: HMD

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, solid construction, same as commercial installations. Installed beside commode it rises out of the way for access if needed. May cost a little more than some but is worth it knowing it won't fall apart a month or year later. Would definately buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: The pulldown bars are the best way to utilize small areas win more than one ...
customer_reviews.text: The pulldown bars are the best way to utilize small areas win more than one use it for a bathroom. I'm a contractor that does handicap assessability. I used five or six of these they are a good quality and I've never had an issue with them. You can usually screw a piece 3/4 inch plywood between two steins and install them to it it works well.
customer_reviews.author: outoftheboxdavid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: This Grab bar has served our household very well.We use it in the bathroom to help my husband arise from the toilet ( and then flip it out of the way) and we installed one as a "railing" for the two steps from the house to the garage. It is sturdy, handy and a good solution to the need.
customer_reviews.author: Jean D Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Grandma Stable when she stands from her chair, in the living room!
customer_reviews.text: This handlebar is a game changer. Gramma uses it for balance when she stands up. Now she is perfectly stable when we're home and when we're away! We ordered the installation on Amazon which was well worth it cause he did a fantastic job and was flexible with scheduling a good time to come. So HAPPY with this purchase! Just a note: the pink wash clothes were added for grandmas comfort. She has trigger finger which makes her hands hurt but otherwise the bar is smooth and comfortable for gripping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this. It comes with lag bolts to install and it didn't work for us for the install location but this thing is heavy duty. I wanted to use it pretty bad. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Tulipane

customer_reviews.title: Flips up and pulls down with ease
customer_reviews.text: We got this in order for my mother to be able to walk up the stairs by herself. She can pull it down and flip it up easily. It was not easy to install as it needs to be attached to a solid beam in the wall which also has a lightswitch
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: freedom
customer_reviews.text: I now don't have to relay on others to assist me when going into my attached garage door where all my tinkering stuff is. It has given me back my confidence that I won't fall and part of my life back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like good quality
customer_reviews.text: I give 5 stars because it looks sturdy and would be easy to install but it would not work for my application so I sent it back. I think it would great for what it is made for.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy and arm lifts out of the way
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability to raise the arm up and out of the way. And yet it is very sturdy. I was concerned about that and the man who put it in put his weight on it, about 200 lb, showing mean that this was a heavy duty piece of equipment! We moved to a house with a tiny master bathroom and this was a godsend
customer_reviews.author: tammie

customer_reviews.title: A Must For Safety
customer_reviews.text: Did is a MUST if you have a handicapped person in your home. You must keep them safe and this does it. We had several smaller grab bars for my husband. This is so much better and stronger than grab bars. We cannot get along without the bar. Try it, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for elderly bathrooms
customer_reviews.text: Dropped two of these in for mom's house. Fantastic and helps her up off the toilet. She also uses it to hold onto while stepping out of the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Al Deshotel

customer_reviews.title: Strong and very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from impaired balance and strength because of an injury a year ago combined with advancing age. These, one each side, enable me to lower myself onto the toilet seat without dropping the last several inches. It's much more comfortable that way.
customer_reviews.author: language lover

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and very sturdy. I installed this for my elderly mother and it has helped her getting in and out of the tub. It looks good and has a great feel. Love that it raises up out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Red HikerTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good safety aid for seniors
customer_reviews.text: My Dad and I put this at the garage entrance to my parent's house, so they can grab it when they are going up the 2 steps into the house. It really is a heavy-duty bar and the 2-bar design makes the height work for both steps. And it folds up mostly out of the way when you want to. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: JimfromMichigan

customer_reviews.title: Moen Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Moen Grab Bar to install beside my mother's toilet to aide her in getting up. It was easy to install. The fold up feature makes it convenient for guests. It comes in stainless or the white that we chose to coordinate with her bathroom's wainscoting and cupboards. Amazon's price was $20 cheaper than other models and shipping was free!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: This bar is great. Had handyman attach to wall
customer_reviews.text: This bar is great. Had handyman attach to wall. It is so helpful for my husband who has Parkinsons. Makes it easier to get up with bars on both sides of commode. I check it often to make sure it is not getting loose. No problems! Folds up for easy cleaning around toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Jolanda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but definitely needs to be attached to a stud. And I don't mean a man, although you might hire one to help you install it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Up to the job
customer_reviews.text: We put this in our bathroom and it takes a lot of abuse. I'm a big guy and it is the best safety bar I've had. I had a handy man put this in. He attached it to a stud with special aviation bolts. It's a good piece of equipment. Very heavy and sturdy. Do yourself a favor-hire a handyman or someone knowledgeable to install it.
customer_reviews.author: girlygirl

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is perfect for my elderly mother! I like it too...so much that I bought another one to go on the other side of our small, 2-step staircase into the garage. Mother couldn't easily get up or down these steps (without hand rails) before. Now, she readily moves both ways, feeling secure enough to grab onto these for support. I, too, use them for extra support when racing back and forth into the house with groceries, etc.! The price was certainly right, with no shipping charge, and arrived promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: VERY STURDY
customer_reviews.text: THIS WORKS GREAT FOR MY HUSBAND WHO IS DISABLED. HAD A CARPENTER INSTALL IT ON THE WALL NEXT TO TOILET TO MAKE SURE IT WAS SECURE. HAD TO NAIL A BOARD TO THE STUDS AND THEN ATTACH THE GRAB BAR TO THE BOARD. PAINTED BOARD AND IT BLENDS RIGHT IN WITH THE WALL COLOR. LOOKS AND WORKS GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Susan DeMay

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Best price on line DON’T BUY IN THE STORES too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Super good price, high quality. But hard for the handicapped to lift up (if they wanted to) we don’t have to life it up so it stays put down.
customer_reviews.author: tresea larson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is wonderfully designed, sturdy and well worth the price. It has helped my mother greatly. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Don't slip, get a grip on this grab bar...
customer_reviews.text: I think it would have worked great, but customer changed her mind.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman247 LLC

customer_reviews.title: Makes mom feel safer!
customer_reviews.text: Well we had to create an accessible bathroom for mom. She just got home and loves the railing. Makes her feel safer. Comes with lag bolts for mounting to a stud. Plan ahead if it's not directly on a stud.
customer_reviews.author: Anne R

customer_reviews.title: This is really a heavy duty grad bar!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a heavy duty grad bar! We found it will not attach solely to a solitary 2 x 4 though because of the wide base. You will need to use a heavy duty anchoring system for three of the holes to attach or build up the wall. We reinforced the wall. Very impressed with the size, weight and construction. It provides an extra level of security for my mother when getting in or out of the tub and maneuvering on and off the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Vesteng

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Great Finish, Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: High quality construction and finish. Sufficient strength when one side is bolted into a stud and the other side into drywall with large wing nuts grasping sheetrock between studs. After all, 1/2 sheet rock seven inches from a stud is strong. Enough hinge friction so that bar stays upright without supplied bracket. Hinge strong enough for my 200lb. elderly father. White finish appeased my picky elderly mother's sense of decor.
customer_reviews.author: A Careful DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Given the ability to fold up when not in use; it is perfect to utilize next to a bed, tub, or toilet
customer_reviews.text: This bar is perfect for confined spaces. Given the ability to fold up when not in use; it is perfect to utilize next to a bed, tub, or toilet. It is much better than a 90degree Floor-wall mounted bar since it folds up out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: A must have for many
customer_reviews.text: I have installed two of these for elderly parents at the entranceway from the garage to the house. With two steps to climb it allows them a safe handhold. My father had fallen a few times prior to installation (he was not badly harmed). After installing them it has been great and super helpful. It helps me sleep much better at night.
customer_reviews.author: RPS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we wanted for our handicap bathroom renovation! Did not rate for install as my contractor did it and i don’t know how that went. Good looking and folds up out of the way when not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ei

customer_reviews.title: were to place the bar.
customer_reviews.text: in placing the bar you have to fine the stud in the wall. if you don't you my just pull it out of the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and easy to install. The only comment I have is that the paint on the hexhead chips during installation. There's really no way around it. I applied some touch up after to clean it up a little.
customer_reviews.author: Mojomike

customer_reviews.title: Attached to 1 1/8 plywood.
customer_reviews.text: Works well when a solid wall mount is available. I like that the bars stay up without a clip when needed. Easy to move up or down.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence W Smith

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father. Very sturdy with a quality finish. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than I thought it would be. But, don't let that stop you. It is perfectly made, quality and helpful getting in and out of shower.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Has been indispensable in bathroom for my disabled wife. ...
customer_reviews.text: Has been indispensable in bathroom for my disabled wife. Swing up function improves use, doesn't get in way when exiting shower. Would have given 5 stars except hold up clamp is secured by 2 screws Tahiti have marked bar. Protection from screws are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: It is very stable in the shower
customer_reviews.text: It is very sturdy and stable for my parent in the shower room. It help when you have elder want to take shower themselve with dignity.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great grab bar and installation tip.
customer_reviews.text: Great grab bar. Preferred this plain one to one with the toilet paper dispenser. Shipping was quick. As far as mounting, suggest you get "WINGITS" which are specifically designed for grab bar installation. We used those plus the included screws which solved the installation problems in other reviews. (We have used WINGITS for installing other grab bars and been very pleased - very solid.)
customer_reviews.author: J. McL

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I never seen one of these before , but it sure does the job when needed and folds away and out of the way. Great product, would order another if needed, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: George Leckband

customer_reviews.title: Price is on
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item before...The best best thing about item it is price...My local suppliers Can't even come close to the items price..Thank you so much..Hey my suppliers may want to buy items thru Amazon....
customer_reviews.author: enrique gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very substantial
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't been installed yet, I'll come back. I just want to say it's MUCH larger than I'd pictured. I better read dimensions next time! The metal plate is 11 1/2 X 6 inches. The bar is 30" long by 8" and as big around as my "normal" grab bars. I'm hoping it'll fit in our tiny bathroom! ***** It is installed and will work well. The clip to hold it up doesn't fit on the wall but I intend to leave it down anyway. I'll try to add a photo.
customer_reviews.author: nobleday

customer_reviews.title: Does it job well
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install with the proper screws. It is very sturdy, looks nice and performs well. While it came with a clamp to attach to the back wall for securing it when in the upright position I have not installed that yet as the joint where the bar pivots has enough internal resistance to keep the bar upright on its own. I doubt this pivot point will ever loosen to the point where I have to install clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Mike from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding... hospital quality
customer_reviews.text: Once you can find 4 studs or anchors ( use huge ones) this item is hospital strength and quality, very heavy duty and folds away when not in use
customer_reviews.author: Gary Skinner

customer_reviews.title: It’s mounted on the wall /very convenient
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this grab bar for my disabled aunt who moved in with us. It’s so much better than stationary chair. The best thing about it to me is that it can be shifted up out of the way when not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Yates

customer_reviews.title: Fingers Crossed!!
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed for my mom. I hope the wall can support it. Its pretty large.
customer_reviews.author: Julie K Eatmon

customer_reviews.title: Great Bar for Handicaped People
customer_reviews.text: We needed a bar between our toilet and tub and it had to be something that could be gotten out of the way and not interfere with geting in and out of the tub. This flip up bar does the job perfectly. It's made by a good company and is reasonably priced. The fit and finish were excellent and if properly installed it is plenty strong to get the job done. We have used it about 5 weeks now and are 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Crhoff

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great , had to install in our new bathroom and it was so easy and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need 2x8 for mounting GREAT PRODUCT My husband is no little guy so I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Wendi alexander

customer_reviews.title: Adds stability.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my bathroom around my toilet. If I fall in the bathroom it is easy for me to lift myself up. I also bought two for outside my door. The add a lot of stability when I step over the threshold. My plumber had never seen these since they are not available locally.
customer_reviews.author: Linny

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two for my mom, who has partial paralysis. Installed one next to the toilet and the other in the shower. We had our handyman install. Very durable, sturdy. Also, another recommendation is a wall attached shower seat.
customer_reviews.author: maureen

customer_reviews.title: It works great and it is very nice to fold it up ...
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid support. Just be sure and reinforce the wall so that you screw this device into solid wood. It works great and it is very nice to fold it up out of the way when not in use. We have one on either side of a handicapped toilet. This arrangement is better that virtually anything I've seen in a business's handicapped bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Installed well, is very sturdy, and is easy to move out of the way, if desired.
customer_reviews.author: Esther M.

customer_reviews.title: difficult
customer_reviews.text: large heavy and too bulky for easy mounting on wall.
customer_reviews.author: Helene Roumel

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have addition to the bathroom for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have addition to the bathroom for anyone that struggles to get up or down for the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L Eppler

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for stability. Put it right /in studs
customer_reviews.author: Lori  A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Safety!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Had to reinforce the wall before installing but I love it. Safe!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Smith

customer_reviews.title: Flip Up Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know if it would work- but it is great. With knee problems, needed something to help getting up from the toilet. Couldn't ise a raised seat due to the tank being curved. Also could not place a commode over it as it is too close to 1 qall. This bar is the answer. It it sturdy & 1 of the best purchases I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend a professional installer for these unless you are very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Miles and Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Mising Hardware and Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the product was dropped, the bag torn and of course all the mounting hardware and instructions missing. Can't blame Moen, had to be the Amazon's poor handling.
customer_reviews.author: Kalifornia Kid

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made, heavy and works well for someone who can't stand and needs something to help with balance
customer_reviews.author: Deerwachr

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT! EVEN GREATER PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up as a steal of a deal. This is the real Moen product, powder coated and solid. Been using this for six months now and it is very helpful for my dad, and the convenience of the fold-up design makes it work well for the shared bathroom. No quality issues. Fit and finish is great. Very sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: N. ARAKI

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great on our newly remodeled bathroom for our special needs son.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Nice, heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: and well built bar. Just we needed in my Father's bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hamer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: solidly built and easy to install. Works great as a grab bar.
customer_reviews.author: randell perkins

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back. Missing parts and was way to heavy. Would not mount on studs as it showed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Morey

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my husband with grab bar on other side ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my husband with grab bar on other side of the toilet. Helps him pull up from wheelchair and keeps him steady.
customer_reviews.author: J. Micalizio

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I needed to provide lift support for my ...
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I needed to provide lift support for my mom. It is length not only allows mom to get up from toilet safely. It also is a hand support for getting out of the tub. Plus the convenience of flipping up and out of the way for cleaning the area under it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Terrific bar - well manufactured from quality materials.
customer_reviews.text: This bar has been in use for weeks now. It provides great support, is the right length, and has two parallel bars so the user can choose to hold onto; the higher or lower one. It has 6 bolts attaching it to the wall and a wall-mounted clip to hold the bar in the upright position.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Fix-it-Lady

customer_reviews.title: Worked to add a handrail to a porch
customer_reviews.text: While meant for bathroom use, it also is useful to use as a fold down handrail on a porch of 2-3 steps if there is a post or wall to mount it to at the top of the steps. The holes are too far apart width wise for 4x4 posts, but I drilled a set of holes near the middle to attach to a 4x4 post. Metal is not the hardest grade, but overall it is sturdy and the powder coat will keep the finish nice. The white blending in with the exterior white trim well.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiznbye

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is that the each end does not allow for 4 screws in each stud, you must use the drywall taps which do not support any weight, so they wiggle a bit. Heavy force can not be put on them without another plate or piece of wood attached to the drywall and secured at the studs, behind it. Fast shipping and sturdy product though
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Goode

customer_reviews.title: Flip Up Grab Bars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality grab bars! They fold up smoothly and easily, and when lowered into place they feel extremely firm and strong. We like the glacier color; it's a nice change to have a choice other than the usual chrome, and it helps reduce that institutional feel you usually get with the chrome bars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy for the money and meets the ADA codes
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to install this bars yet! But I've had it before that's why I ordered them. They are sturdy for the money and meets the ADA codes. The only concern I have is that if there is no stud to install to the Sheetrock will not hold as well over time.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Good for space where assist cannot be hung
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Hudspeth

product_meta.title: Moen R8960FD 30-Inch Flip-Up Screw-In Bathroom Grab Bar with Textured Grip, Stainless
product_meta.description:
Color:PeenedEnjoy greater peace of mind, even in small bathrooms, with the Moen 30-Inch Flip-Up Grab Bar. This ADA grab bar supports up to 300 pounds and provides a reliable handhold whether you're showering, bathing, or using the toilet. The bar flips up and out of the way, helping keep even smaller bathrooms safer and space efficient. Thanks to durable stainless steel construction, this bath grip provides lasting performance.

AMAZON.COM


Flip-up grab bar in stainless (view larger). Safety, comfort, and peace of mind... it's engineered into every Moen Home Care. This 30-inch flip-up grab bar supports up to 300 pounds, and it stores conveniently out of the way when it's not needed. It features corrosion-resistant steel construction for durability, a 30-inch bar length, 1.25-inch bar diameter, and ADA compliance. This version comes in a stainless steel finish, and it's also available in glacier white.

WHAT SETS MOEN APART?
From a variety of styles designed to complement today's decors to faucets that perfectly balance your water pressure, Moen sets the standard for exceptional beauty and reliable, innovative design. Additionally, all Moen products come with a Limited Lifetime Warranty against leaks, drips and finish defects.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Moen R8960 Home Care 30-inch flip up grab bar; installation instructions

R8960 HOME CARE 30-INCH FLIP UP GRAB BAR
AT A GLANCE
 * Grab bar flips up out of the way when not in use
 * Stainless finish
 * Supports up to 300 pounds
 * 30-inch bar length
 * Limited lifetime warranty



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Safety, comfort and peace of mind. It's engineered into every Moen Home Care product we make. You can be sure that when you select Moen, you are getting a product that not only meets the ADA's exacting standards, but yours as well. Moen is dedicated to designing and delivering beautiful products that last a lifetime. Moen offers a diverse selection of kitchen faucets, kitchen sinks, bathroom faucets and accessories, and showering products. Moen products combine style and functionality with durability for a lifetime of customer satisfaction.

See more

SUPPORTIVE DESIGN: Supports up to 300 lbs
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: Stainless steel construction for added durability
ADA COMPLIANT: Complies with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) specifications
BUILT TO LAST: Backed by Moen’s Limited Lifetime Warranty
